intro: Palicourea stipulosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or yellow-eyed grass, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or white, often with two bracts at the base of each flower. Its fruits are small, dry capsules containing several seeds. Palicourea stipulosa is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is often found in moist, shaded habitats.
